CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of texture samples made.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This expression defines the number of texture samples made.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of texture samples made.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This expression defines the number of texture samples made.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The average number of texture filtering cycles per instruction.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This expression defines the average number of texture filtering cycles per instruction. For texture-limited content that has a CPI higher than the optimal throughout of this core ({{C::MaliTexSamplePerCy.equation}} samples per cycle), consider using simpler texture filters. See {{C::MaliTexIssueCy}} for details of the expected performance for different types of operation.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The percentage utilization of the texturing unit.
CounterInfo.LongDescription:
This expression defines the percentage utilization of the texturing unit.
The most effective technique for reducing texturing unit load is reducing the number of texture samples read by your shaders. Using 32bpp color formats, and the ASTC decode mode extensions to select a 32bpp intermediate precision, can reduce cache access cost. Using simpler texture filters can reduce filtering cost. Using a 16bit per component sampler result can reduce data return cost.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The percentage utilization of the texturing unit cache lookup path.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This expression defines the percentage utilization of the texturing unit cache lookup path.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of thread-width texture operations processed.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This counter increments for every thread-width texture operation processed by the texture unit.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of texture operations that act on a mipmapped texture.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This counter increments for every texture operation that acts on a mipmapped texture. Mipmapping improves texturing quality for 3D scenes by providing some pre-filtering for minified texture samples. It also improves performance because it reduces pressure on texture caches. Aim to use mipmapping for all texturing operations in a 3D scene that read from static input textures.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The percentage of texture operations accessing mipmapped textures.
CounterInfo.LongDescription:
This expression defines the percentage of texture operations accessing mipmapped textures.
Mipmapping significantly improves image quality and memory bandwidth in 3D scenes with variable object view distance. Aim to enable mipmapping for all offline-authored texture assets in 3D content.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of quad-width filtering passes that use a mipmapped texture.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This counter increments for every quad-width filtering pass that uses a mipmapped texture. For applications rendering a 3D scene, Arm recommends using mipmaps as much as possible to improve both image quality and performance.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The percentage of texture operations accessing mipmapped textures.
CounterInfo.LongDescription:
This expression defines the percentage of texture operations accessing mipmapped textures.
Mipmapping significantly improves image quality and memory bandwidth in 3D scenes with variable object view distance. Aim to enable mipmapping for all offline-authored texture assets in 3D content.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of texture operations acting on a compressed texture.
CounterInfo.LongDescription:
This counter increments for every texture operation acting on a compressed texture. Lossy texture compression, such as ASTC and ETC, provides a significant reduction in texture size and bandwidth, improving performance and reducing memory power consumption.
Note that this counter excludes textures compressed using AFBC lossless framebuffer compression.

CounterInfo.HumanName: Texture samples using compressed texture percentage
CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The percentage of texture operations accessing compressed textures.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This expression defines the percentage of texture operations accessing compressed textures. Note that compressed textures in this instance means API-level compression, such as ETC and ASTC. The AFBC lossless framebuffer compression is not included.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of texture line fetches from the L2 cache.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This counter increments for every texture line fetch from the L2 cache.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of texture line fetches from the L2 cache that are block compressed textures.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This counter increments for every texture line fetch from the L2 cache that is a block compressed texture. Note that this counter excludes lines compressed using the AFBC lossless compression scheme.

CounterInfo.HumanName: Texture data fetches from compressed lines
CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The percentage of texture line fetches that are from block compressed textures.
CounterInfo.LongDescription:
This expression defines the percentage of texture line fetches that are from textures using API block compression, such as ASTC or ETC2.
Texture compression significantly reduces memory bandwidth consumption, so aim to maximize this percentage by compressing all offline-authored texture assets. However, note that this counter does not include texture data fetches from framebuffers compressed with AFBC lossless compression.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of texture operations acting on a 3D texture.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This counter increments for every texture operation acting on a 3D texture. 3D filtering is half the performance of 2D filtering.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The percentage of texture operations accessing 3D textures.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This expression defines the percentage of texture operations accessing 3D textures.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of texture operations using a trilinear texture filter.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This counter increments for every texture operation that uses a trilinear texture filter. Trilinear filtering is half the performance of bilinear filtering.

CounterInfo.HumanName: Texture accesses using trilinear filter percentage
CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The percentage of texture operations using trilinear filtering.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This expression defines the percentage of texture operations using trilinear filtering. Trilinear samples are twice the cost of simple bilinear samples.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of quad-width filtering passes that use a trilinear filter.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This counter increments for every quad-width filtering pass that uses a trilinear filter.

CounterInfo.HumanName: Texture accesses using trilinear filter percentage
CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The percentage of texture operations using trilinear filtering.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This expression defines the percentage of texture operations using trilinear filtering. Trilinear samples are twice the cost of simple bilinear samples.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of texture filtering issue cycles.
CounterInfo.LongDescription:
This counter increments for every texture filtering issue cycle. This GPU can do {{C::MaliTexSamplePerCy.equation}}x 2D bilinear texture samples per clock. More complex filtering operations are composed of multiple 2D bilinear samples, and take proportionally more filtering time to complete. The costs per sample are:
* 2D bilinear filtering takes one cycle. * 2D trilinear filtering takes two cycles. * 3D bilinear filtering takes two cycles. * 3D trilinear filtering takes four cycles. * Sampling from multi-plane YUV takes one cycle per plane.
Anisotropic filtering makes multiple filtered subsamples which are combined to make the final output sample color. For a filter with MAX_ANISOTROPY of N, up to N times the cycles of the base filter are required.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of cycles when threads are stalled at the texel coordinate calculation stage.
CounterInfo.LongDescription:
This counter increments every clock cycle when threads are stalled at the texel coordinate calculation stage.
These stalled threads can occur when the texture cache is full of threads waiting for data and the cache is unable to accept new threads.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of cycles when at least one thread is waiting for data from the texture cache, but no lookup is completed.
CounterInfo.LongDescription:
This counter increments every clock cycle when at least one thread is waiting for data from the texture cache, but no lookup is completed.
This event occurs if no new threads enter the data fetch stage from texel address calculation, and all threads that are already in the data fetch stage are still waiting for their data.

CounterInfo.HumanName: Texture filtering partial data stall cycles
CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of cycles when at least one thread fetched some data from the texture cache, but no filtering operation is started.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This counter increments every clock cycle when at least one thread fetched some data from the texture cache, but no filtering operation is started because no thread has all the data that it requires.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of quad-width texture operations processed by the texture unit.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This counter increments for every quad-width texture operation processed by the texture unit.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of quad-width texture operations processed by the texture unit.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This counter increments for every quad-width texture operation processed by the texture unit.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of quad-width texture operations processed by the texture unit.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This counter increments for every quad-width texture operation processed by the texture unit.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of quad-width texture operations processed by the texture unit.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This counter increments for every quad-width texture operation processed by the texture unit.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of quad-width filtering passes.
CounterInfo.LongDescription:
This counter increments for every quad-width filtering pass. A single texture operation is split into multiple bilinear passes for:
* Use of trilinear filtering * Use of anisotropic filtering * Use of a 3D texture format * Use of a cubemap texture format that requires data from multiple cube faces.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of quad-width filtering passes that miss in the resource or sampler descriptor cache.
CounterInfo.LongDescription:
This counter increments for every quad-width filtering pass that misses in the resource or sampler descriptor cache. A high miss rate in the descriptor cache can indicate:
* Cache thrashing because of too many unique texture or sampler descriptors * A high memory fetch latency causing multiple sampling operations to miss on the same descriptor

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of texture cache lookup cycles.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This counter increments for every texture cache lookup cycle. A high number of cache lookups per pass can indicate a poor access pattern, that sparsely samples texels from a high resolution texture. This normally occurs for 3D content that has failed to use mipmaps, and so accesses the high resolution level 0 surface when an object is distant from the camera.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of texture filtering issue cycles.
CounterInfo.LongDescription:
This counter increments for every texture filtering issue cycle. This GPU can do {{C::MaliTexSamplePerCy.equation}}x 2D bilinear texture samples per clock. More complex filtering operations are composed of multiple 2D bilinear samples, and take proportionally more filtering time to complete.
* 2D trilinear filtering runs at half speed. * 3D bilinear filtering runs at half speed. * 3D trilinear filtering runs at quarter speed.
Anisotropic filtering makes up to MAX_ANISOTROPY filtered subsamples of the current base filter type. For example, using trilinear filtering with a MAX_ANISOTROPY of 3 will require up to 6 bilinear filters.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of texture filtering issue cycles.
CounterInfo.LongDescription:
This counter increments for every texture filtering issue cycle. This GPU can do {{C::MaliTexSamplePerCy.equation}}x 2D bilinear texture samples per clock. More complex filtering operations are composed of multiple 2D bilinear samples, and take proportionally more filtering time to complete. The scaling factors for more expensive operations are:
* 2D trilinear filtering runs at half speed. * 3D bilinear filtering runs at half speed. * 3D trilinear filtering runs at quarter speed.
Anisotropic filtering makes up to MAX_ANISOTROPY filtered subsamples of the current base filter type. For example, using trilinear filtering with a MAX_ANISOTROPY of 3 will require up to 6 bilinear filters.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of texture filtering issue cycles.
CounterInfo.LongDescription:
This counter increments for every texture filtering issue cycle. This GPU can do {{C::MaliTexSamplePerCy.equation}}x 2D bilinear texture samples per clock. More complex filtering operations are composed of multiple 2D bilinear samples, and take proportionally more filtering time to complete. The scaling factors for more expensive operations are:
* 2D trilinear filtering runs at half speed. * 3D bilinear filtering runs at half speed. * 3D trilinear filtering runs at quarter speed.
Anisotropic filtering makes up to MAX_ANISOTROPY filtered subsamples of the current base filter type. For example, using trilinear filtering with a MAX_ANISOTROPY of 3 will require up to 6 bilinear filters.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of cycles the texture unit was busy.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This expression measures the number of cycles the texture unit was busy processing work.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of cycles the texture unit was busy.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This expression measures the number of cycles the texture unit was busy processing work.
CounterInfo.Equation: max(MaliTexFiltIssueCy, MaliTexCacheLookupCy, MaliTexCacheSimpleLoadCy, MaliTexCacheComplexLoadCy, MaliTexInBt, MaliTexOutBt, MaliTexL1CacheOutputCy, MaliTexL1CacheLookupCy, MaliTexIndexCy)

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of texture request message data beats.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This counter increments for every clock cycle of input request data sent to the texture unit.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The percentage load on the texture message input bus.
CounterInfo.LongDescription:
This expression defines the percentage load on the texture message input bus.
If bus utilization is higher than the filtering unit utilization, your content might be limited by texture operation parameter passing. Requests that require more input parameters, such as 3D accesses, array accesses, and accesses using an explicit level-of-detail, place a higher load on the bus than basic 2D texture operations.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of texture response message data beats.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This counter increments for every clock cycle of output response data sent by the texture unit.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The percentage load on the texture message output bus.
CounterInfo.LongDescription:
This expression defines the percentage load on the texture message output bus.
If bus utilization is higher than the filtering unit utilization, your content might be limited by texture result return. Requests that require higher precision sampler return type place a higher load on the bus, so it is recommended to use a 16-bit sampler precision whenever possible.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of output texture messages from the texture unit.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This counter increments for every texture message emitted by the texture unit.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of single quad output texture messages from the texture unit.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This counter increments for every texture message emitted by the texture unit which only contains a single quad.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of cycles when a quad is stalled on texture descriptor fetch.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This counter increments for every clock cycle a quad is stalled on texture descriptor fetch. This might not correspond to a stall cycle in the filtering unit if there is enough work already buffered after the descriptor fetcher to hide the stall.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of cycles when a quad is stalled on entering texture fetch because the fetch queue is full.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This counter increments for every clock cycle a quad is stalled on entering texture fetch because the fetch queue is full. This might not correspond to a stall cycle in the filtering unit if there is enough work already buffered to hide the stall.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of cycles when the filtering unit is idle and there is at least one quad present in the texture data fetch queue.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This counter increments for every clock cycle the filtering unit is idle and there is at least one quad present in the texture data fetch queue. A high stall rate here can be indicative of content which is failing to make good use of the texture cache. For example, under-sampling from a high resolution texture.

CounterInfo.HumanName: Texture filtering cycles using full bilinear
CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of cycles when the filtering unit is filled with bilinear filtering.
CounterInfo.LongDescription:
This counter increments for every clock cycle when the filtering unit data path is running full speed bilinear filtering.
Filtering will run at half rate for formats that are stored in the cache at more than 32-bits per decompressed texel.

CounterInfo.HumanName: Texture filtering cycles using full trilinear
CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of cycles when the filtering unit is filled with trilinear filtering.
CounterInfo.LongDescription:
This counter increments for every clock cycle when the filtering unit data path is running full speed trilinear filtering.
Filtering will run at half rate for formats that are stored in the cache at more than 32-bits per decompressed texel.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of cycles computing texel index values.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This counter increments for every clock cycle when the texture unit is computing a texel index value.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of cycles returning data from the texture cache.
CounterInfo.LongDescription:
This counter increments for every clock cycle when the texture cache is returning data.
A high value here can be indicative of a inefficient post-decompression texture formats. For example, a 64-bpp format takes twice as long as a 32-bpp format.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of cycles loading simple texture formats.
CounterInfo.LongDescription:
This counter increments for every clock cycle when the texture cache is fetching formats with simple data layouts using the direct path.
A high value here can be indicative of a high cache miss rate in the texture data cache.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of cycles loading complex texture formats.
CounterInfo.LongDescription:
This counter increments for every clock cycle when the texture cache is fetching formats with complex data layouts using the decompressor path.
A high value here can be indicative of a high cache miss rate in the texture data cache.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of cycles the L1 cache is being loaded.
CounterInfo.LongDescription:
This counter increments for every clock cycle when data is being transferred into the L1 texture cache.
A high value here can be indicative of a high cache miss rate in the texture data cache.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of cycles the L1 cache is being accessed.
CounterInfo.LongDescription:
This counter increments for every clock cycle when the L1 texture cache is being accessed.
A high value here can be indicative of a high cache miss rate in the texture data cache.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of cycles the L1 cache is returning data.
CounterInfo.LongDescription:
This counter increments for every clock cycle when the L1 texture cache is returning data for a sampling operation.
A high value here can be indicative of a high cache miss rate in the texture data cache.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The percentage of texture filtering cycles using the full width of the texture filtering data path.
CounterInfo.LongDescription:
This expression defines the percentage of texture filtering cycles using the full width of the texture filtering data path.
Filtering will run at half rate for formats that are stored in the cache at more than 32-bits per decompressed texel. When using the ASTC texture format, use the decode mode extensions to opt-in to a 32-bit per pixel intermediate format to ensure you can use the full filtering performance.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of cycles the texture unit was active.
CounterInfo.LongDescription:
This counter increments for every clock cycle when the texture unit is active, and contains an active sample message.
A high active time does not imply a high utilization. The unit counts as active even if only a single pipeline stage is busy.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of cycles the texture unit was active but did not return a texture sample.
CounterInfo.LongDescription:
This counter increments for every clock cycle when the texture unit is active and a response message could be accepted, but no response was generated.
A high value here can be indicative of a inefficient texturing operations which are failing to sustain full throughput, and can be caused by a high miss rate in either descriptor or data cache, or complex multicycle filtering operations.
